contains.name: (a Book: The Lost Letters of Girr'Kaaz)

equipped.name: (a Shield of Mother's Love...It glows pink!)
(a golden locket on a filigree chain)

contains.name: (a piece of paper with the secret of immortality on it)

mobs.long_desc: A gruesome old witch cackles merrily to herself as she walks toward you..
mobs.desc: This ancient hag must be part troll! Taller than the average man, yet hunched over almost double, with a long, hooked nose and pointy chin, and with her numerous sharp teeth, she resembles a nightmare more than a person.

mobs.long_desc: The Gypsy Prince whirls right past you in a dervish dance.
mobs.desc: The Prince is a little taller than most men, with broad shoulders, a lithe, graceful body, and a heroic presence that most people just wish they had. His eyes and hair are nearly black, they're so dark. He wears an elegant, billowy white shirt, dark leather trews laced at the knees, and a blue leather vest with golden tassles hanging from it. He looks every inch like royalty.

mobs.long_desc: A beautiful gypsy dancer looks at you with black-rimmed eyes as she dances sensuously around you.
mobs.desc: She dances and laughs, her voice like a bell, so clear and sweet your breath catches in your throat. Tall and slim, with her long, dark curly hair held back by a dark rose-colored scarf shot with gold, she seems to project a charisma and nobility that you've never seen before. Her clothes cling to and accentuate her figure -- a billowy, low-cut white blouse tucked into an ankle-length, flowing dark aquamarine blue circle skirt that flares all around her legs as she moves..

mobs.long_desc: A grotesque, vaguely man-shaped form tries to hide from you.
mobs.desc: This creature is about man-height, and about man-shaped, but he surely is no human being! His pocked and scarred skin, what you see of it through the numerous gaps and rips in his clothing, is almost green in hue. He seems smaller and weaker than an average goblin.

mobs.long_desc: A maiden with snowy white hair searches the woods.
mobs.desc: This tall, slender maiden is as pale as milk and as bright as a star. Her snowy white hair cascades down her back to her waist, where it's loosely caught in a silver clasp shaped like a flower. Her rosebud-shaped mouth is pursed in worry, and her dark blue eyes are shaded with concern, as she searches through the trees and shrubs for something.

mobs.long_desc: A girl hovers just above the water's surface.
mobs.desc: This sinuous, lithe girl doesn't appear to be much older than a teenager, but she's far more well-developed than most teenagers. Nubile and pretty in a very entrancing way, she floats on the surface of the water most of the time, and though she wears no clothing, mosses and river plants cover her blue-tinged skin and twine around her body, hiding the naughtiest parts of it from lecherous eyes.

mobs.long_desc: The way east is barred by a thick wooden door. The door is closed.
mobs.desc: This strong, sturdy wooden door stands stoically at the entrance of the house. It is spiked with iron bars and its handle is a bit rusted.

mobs.long_desc: A handsome, dark-eyed gypsy dancer dances circles around you.
mobs.desc: He is enchanting.. his eyes, dark and mysterious, inviting you to untold pleasures and illicit, playful secrets. Tall and swarthy, as all of his race tend to be, he wears traditional Gypsy garb -- voluminous white shirt, colorful sash, and tight black breeches, set off with a sash on his head.

mobs.long_desc: A floating, translucent horse covered in cruel chains bares its teeth at you.
mobs.desc: This horse seems to have no hooves! He floats above the ground, his body about where you'd expect a living horse's to be. The horse is a translucent white, and his noble lines make it obvious that in life he was a treasured battle-companion. Now, instead of his saddle and bridle, he wears a multitude of heavy, ghostly chains that clank and clatter with each move he makes. It seems so horribly unfair that such a well-formed and noble creature would be so cruelly mistreated in the afterlife!

mobs.long_desc: A roaring ogrill rushes at you the moment he sees you!
mobs.desc: This raging, half-human beast is easily half again your size, with bulging muscles moving under bare skin the color of sunset. He wears no clothes, though his thick reddish hair covers most of his body. Though obviously young, his muscles not quite fully developed, he's still a fear-inspiring monster.

mobs.long_desc: The Goblin King wanders his realm, smacking his lips.
mobs.desc: While most goblins look sniveling or cowardly, this one does not in the least convey any sense of unregality. Almost noble in bearing, his skin is less green than those of his people, his eyes perhaps a trifle larger and more introspective. He seems like a strong king, one who'd govern with an iron fist, one who could bring the goblins to greatness. Despite yourself, you can't help but admire the fellow.

mobs.long_desc: A grotesque, vaguely man-shaped form tries to hide from you.
mobs.desc: This creature is about man-height, and about man-shaped, but he surely is no human being! His pocked and scarred skin, what you see of it through the numerous gaps and rips in his clothing, is almost green in hue. His long nose seems to be able to scent you on the breeze, while his beady little eyes check you out for weaknesses he can exploit.

mobs.keywords: warder syric-warder syric warrior mad mad-warrior
mobs.long_desc: A mad warrior wanders the mountains endlessly.
mobs.desc: Once he might have been a great warrior. Now he is but a shadow of his former greatness. Mighty of form, with massive arms and shoulders, and long blond hair caught in a leather thong, he seems an incredibly daunting opponent. His clothes and armors, once gotten from kings and queens for his bravery, hang on him in tatters, but his fists are still keen weapons.

mobs.long_desc: A fierce ogrill roars the second he sees you, rushing at you!
mobs.desc: This raging beast is easily half again your size, with bulging muscles moving under bare skin the color of sunset. He wears no clothes, though his thick reddish hair covers most of his body. He seems pulled right out of someone's nightmare -- a mixture of madness and savagery you've never before encountered.

mobs.long_desc: An ancient evil stalks the land...
mobs.desc: This figure comes out of myth to assault your hope and your fears. Tall and ominous-looking, it wears an ancient, hooded cloak that's patched in many places and hanging in tatters. You cannot make out the figure's face. When it looks up at you, though, you feel a charge of fear.

mobs.long_desc: A beautiful faerie queen flits from flower to flower.
mobs.desc: She is glorious! Smaller than the average woman, the slim nymphlike girl doesn't seem to have a care in the world. Her long ash-blonde hair hangs in curls down her back, held in by the two wings that bear her aloft. Flowers and vines adorn her hair and throat and wrists, and her various articles of clothing seem like they were tacked on, like handkerchiefs made of tulle.

mobs.long_desc: A faerie flits from flower to flower.
mobs.desc: This little sprite flies about on her glittery, shimmering butterfly wings, laughing like the tinkling of little bells.  Her hair isn't any color you've ever seen on any mortal!  She's short and stick-slender, and fairly glows with some kind of magical aura.

mobs.long_desc: The vague form of a robed man looks at you intently.
mobs.desc: This middle-aged man wears dun-colored robes. His eyes seem very wise, as well as very old. Other than his very serene expression, he does not seem in the slightest worthy of note.

mobs.long_desc: A tattooed gypsy walks resolutely past you on her spirit quest.
mobs.desc: This fierce gypsy woman wears the temporary markings that declare that she is on her spirit quest. Young but determined, with her dark hair bound out of her eyes, she wears traveler's clothes. She doesn't seem to be interested in a fight.

mobs.long_desc: A fish leaps merrily above the water.
mobs.desc: This beautiful fish leaps and dances before your eyes, without a care in the world. Its eyes seem somehow intelligent.

mobs.long_desc: A brave, earnest-looking lad searches through the Realm.
mobs.desc: His hair is carrot orange, his eyes a very earnest, piercing light blue. He's tall and gangly, though his developing form promises to become that of the true hero soon. He seems hopelessly naive as he blunders around searching for something.

mobs.long_desc: A slave girl averts her eyes from the horror before her.
mobs.desc: This poor young woman's been badly mistreated.  Her light blonde hair is quite dirty, while bruises are evident everywhere through the torn and filthy shift she wears.  The only sign you have that she must once have been of high station is the tilt of her head as she looks at you -- it is not the simpering gaze of one who's been born a slave, but rather the inquisitive glance that wouldn't be out of place on any high-born lady's face.

mobs.long_desc: A beautiful gypsy dancer looks at you with black-rimmed eyes as she dances sensuously around you.
mobs.desc: She dances and laughs, her voice like a bell, so clear and sweet your breath catches in your throat. Tall and slim, with her long, dark curly hair held back by a dark rose-colored scarf shot with gold, she seems to project a charisma and nobility that you've never seen before. Her clothes cling to and accentuate her figure -- a billowy, low-cut white blouse tucked into an ankle-length, flowing dark aquamarine blue circle skirt that flares all around her legs as she moves..

objects.ground: A long, delicate phoenix feather glows like a star here.

extras.text: This delicate golden feather is about as long as your forearm.  The long, lacy fronds of the feather's plumage waft slightly in the breeze.  Oh, and it also glows like the sun.  Just touching it makes your spirit soar!

objects.ground: A plain little wooden box is tightly closed.

extras.text: You behold a very simple wooden box. The tiny slats of the fist-sized container are made of poorly cured wood that is warped and cracked in places. A richly patina'd bronze clasp fastens the box's lid shut.

objects.ground: A very ornamental mythical key lies here.

extras.text: This golden key is ornamented with small gems, but it's not very heavy or even very complicated looking. Scratched into its surface, you see some words scratched into its surface in a strange, runish script.

The words are in a language you cannot understand, one that the gods alone comprehend. If you were, in fact, immortal, you'd know that the words read something like "PROPERTY OF METAMORPHO", but if you're not, you don't. There's a small circle stamped near the key's end.
Just where the key's shaft becomes a circle, a small circle is stamped into the metal surface. The circle has an engraving of what appears to be a rectangular box of some sort inside it.

objects.ground: A sparkling artesian well bubbles up from the ground.

extras.text: This well, a pool of water edged in red-brown bricks, bubbles up from beneath your feet. To drink from it, you must kneel on the bricks carefully!

objects.ground: A gypsy tambourine plays itself sadly here.

extras.text: This tambourine is made of two wooden discs pegged together.  Through the gaps in between them, someone has thrust pairs of small brass circles.  The slightest movement makes the circles jingle together, producing a wild, mysterious cacophony.

objects.ground: An ancient letter is folded up on the ground.

extras.text: It is written in ink that has gone brown with age on parchment that is nearly yellow. The edges crumble as you read; you take special care not to destroy this missive from the past. But it reads only: My beloved Arturio, please believe that I act only to protect you and Frederick. Remember the chants and spells I taught you and the rest of our family, and remember that yours is a rich heritage. Should you ever need the help of the Goddess Mielikki, you need only ask. The letter has been folded and refolded many, many times.

objects.short: a golden locket on a filigree chain
objects.ground: A gold locket on a filigree chain lies here.

extras.text: You've never seen such exquisite goldworking.  This locket, on its whisper-thin golden link necklace, seems very old.  The hinges on it are coming a bit loose, but it's still pretty tightly closed.

objects.ground: A hand-painted portrait the size of your palm lies here.

extras.text: The woman in this painting is amazingly beautiful, but in the same way that a deadly sword is beautiful. She's exactly like a sword -- whipcord-lithe, slender, well-muscled, and seems as if she is about to strike. Her eyes seem incredibly intelligent and perceptive. The portrait is no bigger than the palm of your hand, making the artistry of the representation seem all the more amazing. The woman in the painting is looking right out at the viewer. As you watch, her full, lush lips move, and you hear words: "My little Frederick, remember that I am always watching over you." You hear no more.

objects.ground: A long, partecolored robe lies folded on the ground.

extras.text: This coat is made of long, narrow strips of cloth and leather sewn together into a long-sleeved, heavy robe with inlaid armholes.  The cloth is red, blue, and purple velvet, alternating with black leather.  When you put it on, your head tingles with new ideas and the residue of dreams, making you feel a little wild-eyed.

objects.ground: A cherry-wood desk, exquisitely carved, stands here.

extras.text: This desk is hand-made, and seems very old. A traditional rolltop desk with lots of room to write letters on, it has a multitude of little drawers. One in particular feels a bit loose.
The desk has two drawers going up its sides. One of the drawers -- the one on the upper left-hand side -- rattles a bit as you pull on it, as if locked many eons ago.

objects.short: a Book: The Lost Letters of Girr'Kaaz
objects.ground: A leatherbound book seems to be lying here.

extras.text: The book is leatherbound. It's quite old, obviously. When you open it, a cloud of fine dust flies up, tickling your nose and stinging your eyes. Each of the yellowed, crumbling pages is written in the same crabbed, faltering handwriting. It's quite difficult to read, but you puzzle it out slowly. A Table of Contents says that the thin volume contains five separate letters. It is divided into sections by a beautiful coloured painting bound right into the book. You can look at section1, section2, section3, section4, or section5.

This page's facing page features a beautiful illumined picture of a man facing a large group of demonic creatures. He holds up his glowing hands and seems to have no fear at all in his face. The text reads: I have been traveling our realm for many years, and find myself falling to anger at the blatant slap in the face issued to the Order of Mielikki by Blackmourne's minions. Now, I know, being an old priest who has been fighting Evil for many years, that I should exercise discretion, that this will pass. But somehow, this latest assault on our charter feels different, and I have no confidence that the Gods of our land will protect us this time from the Archenemy. Morpheous, one of our patron gods, has been molding us for many years under the tutelage of the wise Kaaz clan. I suppose it is inevitable that our society, so deftly ruled and so wisely shepherded, would become a cause for jealousy. In my prayers, I have sensed the hatred and envy of the foul god Blackmourne. I pray he does not raise his hand against the world -- for if he does, who can stop a god? Not even the Kaaz clan could stand against all the evil a god may cause. Be ready for anything. The call to defend our gracious Goddess may come at any time, and we must not allow Blackmourne to prevail. In Yr. Service Girr'Kaaz, High Priest of Mielikki

This section is faced with a picture of a decayed, disgusting human figure wearing a long, black silk robe. His face reveals no trace of normal human gentleness and kindness -- the cloak of his many years hangs very heavy on him. He's pure evil. The text on the next page reads: I have been traveling our realm for many years, my brothers and sisters in the faith, and I know that my learning is as yet not complete. However, bear with the words of one who is still learning: HOW can the Lord of Templace not demand the head of Ruin Wormheart on a golden plate? How can he not see the perfidy and cruelty of this supposed priest? Every day brings a new rumour and a new crime, and every day we see more of those vile Undead Knights coming into our beautiful cities. Wormheart is daring us to do something, my brothers. I pray none of us acts before the right time has come. Merely by reading the words of Ruin Wormheart's missives, one may get a feeling for the hatred of this person and those around him. He cloaks these evil, vile feelings in words of sweetness and light, but none of those who worship the Goddess can fail to see the truth. My warnings, brothers and sisters: Do not fall prey to this guild, and do not allow Ruin to provoke you... Yet. Our time will come, and we will wipe this degenerate guild from the face of the earth! In Yr. Service Girr'Kaaz, High Priest of Mielikki

This section begins with a picture of the dwarven city, Anduin. The city's walls are in ruins; warriors, both human and not, fight for their very lives against a monstrous horde of demonic creatures. The text of the message reads: Brethren, I have traveled this realm for many years now, and I hope that you all know me well enough to know that I would not waste your time without good reason or without just cause. But this latest outrage demands our immediate attention! Those who can, journey to the twin cities at greatest haste. Those who cannot... Please favour your brethren with prayer and supplication. We will have to make our stand, and we will have to be victorious, or else our Guild will be wiped from the face of the earth. The demons that Blackmourne has called forth have already destroyed the city of the priests, and they have their eyes on the entire known world. We must act now, or we will lose the crowning city of the known realm to the foul creatures beyond the rift. Blackmourne has gained an ally in the equally evil god Angus, and together, their efforts in creating a rift between the demon plane, Gaar'laxxil, and our own has shaken the very foundations of our world. The demons know that should they win this war, they will feast on the fruits of our very world. What folly have we bred in endeavouring to create good! In Yr. Service Girr'Kaaz, High Priest of Mielikki

This last section begins with a barely-colored painting of what must be the City of Templace in its glory years. You recognize the Bronze Golems and the huge gates immediately. In front of it are three human figures, facing two huge humanoid figures. And above the two huge men flies the biggest dragon you have ever seen... The text of the letter reads: My brethren, I write to you with unfortunate news. I was in the city when the greatest atrocity of our age occurred, and it is with the heaviest of hearts that I pass these words on to you. Templace is destroyed, and it can never be rebuilt, and the devastation to the nearby area will never be undone! Angus and Blackmourne opened a rift in the very fabric of this plane, bringing forth horrors from beyond it that no one's mind could comprehend. But our fair Templace stood strong through all the attacks. In desperation, they called forth the great black dragon Sagece from the Plane of Gaar'laxxil. As the beast stepped through the rift, her delicate foot-claws grazed the surface of the lake near Templace, and it turned black as coal in that moment. Our leaders, the great Kaaz clan, defied the assembled evils of the very gods, but the great dragon had help of the vilest sort -- from the direct hand of Blackmourne himself. Girr'Kaaz's power was such that without Blackmourne's aid, Sagece could never have defeated him. Morpheous was deeply saddened by the destruction of his high priest, but imagine his horror when he went to claim the body, and saw that a wound that could only have come from the blade of his own godly brother! He wept, my brethren. Morpheous disappeared from view with the sorry remains of our leader. I do not know what will happen now, but the skies seem to be holding their breaths. Pray, my brethren. In Yr. Service Elythaz, Cardinal of Templace-that-was

These pages of the book face a painting, beautifully rendered, of some sort of aerial explosion on a scale unimaginable to mortal eyes. The text, written in a spidery script, reads: My brethren, there is again peace in our land, but at such a cost I hesitate to relay the story to you, for fear you will think I have taken leave of my senses. The All-Father himself, Metamorpho, appeared out of swirling mists when the city of Templace was destroyed. He was burning with the most holy wrath one can imagine, as terrible as an army with banners. He took up Morpheus, Blackmourne, and Angus, and all was quiet, save for the cries of the wounded. I tried my best to heal whom I could, but my strength was nearly gone. Like everybody on the field -- demon, human, and victim alike -- I carefully watched for the gods' return. When they did return, our gracious lord Morpheous, still holding the broken body of our Girr'Kaaz, performed a rite none have ever seen. Elia was furious that she could not perform the funeral rites, but she loves Morpheous as much as a human heart can love a god, so she allowed Morpheous to set his binding upon the world. The sky sparkled both with the power of the enchantment, and with the presence of many other gods, some of whom were newborn, some old and dear presences. They put their seal upon the ceremony. When it was over, Girr'Kaaz's body turned to a kind of faerie-light that scattered all over the world. I write you only what I have seen, brethren. The gods did disappear just afterward, though I think Morpheous gazed upon the battlefield a short while. The Kaaz clan, what was left of it, scattered as well. I have not seen any of them since the battle. So that is where we are now, my brethren. Our mission is to rebuild this sorely shattered world and finish erasing the evils brought here by those whose greed nearly shattered everything we hold dear. If you happen to meet one of the Kaaz, do not alarm them, but report their movements to the Guild. I pray for their mental healing. In Yr. Service, Ausentharn, A Priest of the Northlands

objects.short: a Shield of Mother's Love...It glows pink!
objects.ground: A shield radiates love and kindness...It glows pink!

extras.text: This shield is made of bright blue-white steel, but it glows with a faint pink aura.  The design on the front is ancient and very familiar, though you can't immediately place it for now.  And if you put your ear against its softly thrumming surface, you can hear what seems to be a lullaby, in a strong female voice touched with gentleness.

objects.ground: A golden crown inlaid with emeralds rolls around here.

extras.text: This crown seems pretty heavy.  It's made of thick gold, and probably incredibly expensive.  The gold is shaped into the traditional peaks of crowns. A green emerald, marquise-cut, is set into each peak, and several of them in various cuts adorn the very front of the crown's tallest peak, which would be centered over the wearer's forehead.

objects.ground: A large leatherbound book glows golden.

extras.text: The glowing pages glow with power, telling a story older than time itself -- that of gods and mortals, struggles with beasts greater than any the world has ever known, true love and blackest hatred, friendship and betrayal..  All couched in the language of ancient times to form a manual of behavior for magicians in the aftermath of a war the likes of which may never be seen again...  Though the majority of the ancient book's thick pages seem torn out or damaged, enough of it remains for you to see that it must be very valuable. The cover looks like a good place to start learning about this book.
The cover of the book reads: THE ENCHIRIDION: BEING A MANUAL FOR THE RECOVERY OF MAGISH VITALITY You open the book, and see page1.

Hear the words of one who speaks across time: the Gypsy Seeress Mressnerah: My dear Hrathis, Long ago, my master told these things to me, and now that I am old, I wish to pass them down to you. When you have come into your full power, you will understand why I demanded certain things of you. Long ago, magicians walked this world with impunity. There was nothing we could not do. I remember those days very well indeed. The Cardinal of Templace himself was amazed at our bravery, for we could face the Riftwar beasts alone, with only our magicks to protect us. The book continues on page2.

The second page continues: But the wizard-dragon Sagece, that foul beast from the Demon Planes, despised our kind and put her entire energies to work to destroy our control over the human worlds. This she did, all too well. I was old even when I felt the shockwave of whatever spell she cast that was to spell our doom. I looked down at my body and saw the rejuvenation I had depended on for beauty disappear, the strength I'd always felt dissipate like fog before the morning light. From then on, I was helpless physically; only when I had the protection of much stronger folk could I work my most devastating magicks. But behold, Hrathis. There is way to reverse this evil enchantment. The page ends. The next page is page3.

This page seems very washed out. In fact, it's almost impossible to make out any details of what was once printed here. All you can see is what appears to be a blueprint of some kind of large machine. The small caption near the bottom of the page reads "NAU I S". That is all you can tell for sure.

objects.ground: A hood made of purple leather glows with an eerie light.

extras.text: The hood is purple leather, soft as silk, ornamented with golden ribbon around the edges.  Its lappets hang down the wearer's chest and back, allowing the hood to fall back.  An attendant air of disaster seems to hang around this hood, but you must admit, it is very flattering.

objects.short: the Swan Princess' Cloak of Feathers
objects.ground: A cloak of white feathers shimmers in the light.

extras.text: This beautiful cloak is made of some kind of silky white fabric sewn all over with the most amazing white feathers.  Each full, white feather has a single dark blue dot near its tip, giving the cloak a kind of shimmery nature as it turns from white to dappled.  The cloak fits closely about its wearer's body, with a white leather clasp holding it closed at the throat and at the waist.

objects.short: a pair of translucent faerie wings
objects.ground: A pair of translucent faerie wings scintillate.

extras.text: These wings look so real!  A metallic golden frame supports two somewhat large wings made of some kind of silk that stretches to the point of being almost transparent.  Some kind of sparkly things are woven into the silk, making the wings shimmer as they move.

objects.ground: A vicious-looking scythe stands against a wall.

extras.text: The scythe's blade is about the length of a human's leg, curved inward and polished to a shine.  It's mounted onto a wooden shaft about the same length as the blade.  Overall, it's a gruesome weapon.

objects.short: the Blade of the Forgotten Kings
objects.ground: A long, heavy sword with a jewelled pommel rests here.

extras.text: This sword's easily the length of your entire arm, and the blade itself is thick and wide, with a blood groove deeply etched into its center.  It's clearly incredibly old.  You just can't find this kind of workmanship these days.

objects.ground: A smelly fish part rots here.

extras.text: How disgusting! This bit of slick leathery fish bulges slightly, from whatever its previous owner ate just before they parted ways. It smells absolutely foul.

objects.short: a piece of paper with the secret of immortality on it
objects.ground: A nondescript paper lies here.

extras.text: A pity you can't read anything on this paper. It's written in the language of the gods. If you could read it, you'd know exactly what magicks are required to become immortal. Of course, if you could read it, you'd also already be immortal.

objects.ground: A thin piece of iron lies here.

extras.text: It's a thin, light piece of oblong iron with a tiny hook at one end. Nondescript and easy to carry concealed, it gives nimble fingers that much better of a chance of opening locks.

objects.ground: A smelly fish part rots here.

extras.text: How disgusting! This bit of slick leathery fish bulges slightly, from whatever its previous owner ate just before they parted ways. It smells absolutely foul.

objects.ground: A breastpiece of scalemail glints with hidden power.

extras.text: This mail is made of some sort of steel alloy worked into fish scale-shaped pieces that interlace together, providing a light but very strong protection against damage.  Each scale is embossed along its edges.

objects.short: a little vial of faerie elixir
objects.ground: A cunning little vial of clear liquid floats past.

extras.text: This little glass bottle looks so delicate you swear you could destroy it with a gentle breath of air.  Its stopper is made of some kind of filigree that somehow still keeps the liquid in the vial from spilling out.  The liquid itself is clear and seems to bubble and sway all by itself inside the bottle.

objects.ground: A cauldron bubbles on the hearth.

extras.text: The soup is incredibly bad-smelling. Small humanoid bones float in it, along with chopped-up vegetables.

objects.ground: You see the tip of a spiral horn on a chain.

extras.text: This pendant is made of the very tip of a spiral horn.  It's been drilled so a primitive chain can support it.  The horn glows with power.

objects.short: a pair of snug-fitting purple tights
objects.ground: A pair of tights has been rolled into a ball and discarded.

extras.text: These tights look like they'd be a perfect fit!  A tie-waist secures them at the waist, and the thick woolen material goes from there all the way down to your feet.  They look quite old, and seem to glow with some kind of magical power.  Perhaps they're enchanted!

objects.ground: Some plaited flowers form a sort of belt.

extras.text: You see a loose belt made of braided wildflowers.  The daisies and honeysuckles were connected by threading each flower through its neighbor somehow.  They must be enchanted, for you cannot separate any of the flowers from the belt.

objects.ground: A blue steel girth flashes with its own lightning.

extras.text: You can see that this girth must be not only magical, but intrinsically strong, for though it is very old, there are no dents, dings, or scratches in its shockingly blue surface.  It reflects a fierce strike of lightning as you look at it.  But no lightning flashed right then in the sky....

objects.ground: A large pair of bracers lies here.

extras.text: You can tell that only royalty could have afforded to make these.  Made of some dark-green metal alloy, these bracers, made to fit and buckle around a very large arm, are worked in a cunning scrolling design.  They're obviously very old, as well; the metal feels worn in places, as though decades of contact with the same arms have altered their shape slightly.

objects.ground: A fetter's been discarded by a freed slave.

extras.text: This very old shackle's made of steel.  There are numerous little dents in its surface, but it still seems supernaturally strong.  It fastens with a steel clip.

objects.ground: Some official looking legal documents are blowing in the wind.

extras.text: These papers seem to be a deed of some sort.  As you read on you notice a large sum of money was paid to a merchant for the purchase of a young blond haired maiden.  This paper entitles the bearer of this deed, ownership to the aforementioned maiden.

objects.ground: A radiant shard of crystallized dreams coalesces from the ether.

extras.text: Legends tell of times when the veil between the worlds grows thin and small slivers of what exists beyond the penumbra slip into the mortal realm.  In the most miraculous of instances, these slivers crystallize and form objects known as "Dreamshards." As a manifestation of the collective unconscious, this dagger is a testament to the power of wonder and hope.  It scintillates with the inner light of the stuff of dreams themselves.

objects.ground: A key made of chicken bones lies here.

extras.text: Ewww! How disgusting! It's made of the ribs of a dead chicken. The bones are rotted and dry from age, and feel vaguely greasy. The smell is just amazing.

triggers.name: princess_receive
triggers.commands: if %object.vnum% == 58417 wait 1 mecho %self.name% sighs in great relief. wait 2 say Thank you from the bottom of my heart, kind adventurer. say Your deeds shall not go unrewarded. wait 2 mjunk feathers mload obj 58401 give feather %actor.name% set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if !%person.quest_stage[kod_quest]% quest start kod_quest %person.name% endif quest variable kod_quest %person% feather 1 elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done endif

triggers.name: Unicorn girl speech
triggers.commands: wait 1 mechoaround %actor% %self.name% speaks to %actor.name% in a low voice. msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'The King will not free me, even though my obligation of service to him is done.  He shall never have my hand in marriage, thus I shall remain his slave forever.'

triggers.name: swan_unic_rand
triggers.commands: mecho The slave girl sniffs sadly.

triggers.name: Unicorn Girl receive
triggers.commands: if %object.vnum% == 58435 wait 1 mjunk legal mecho %self.name% begins to sob hysterically. say Thank you, thank you so very much! wait 2 rem fetter drop fetter say I am free! wait 2 say Please accept this gift, as reward for setting me free. wait 2 mecho The slave girl pulls a necklace with a spiral horn from her tattered clothes. wait 2 mload obj 58429 give alicorn %actor.name% wait 2 say I must return to my family! mecho The slave girl quickly runs away! set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if !%person.quest_stage[kod_quest]% quest start kod_quest %person.name% endif quest variable kod_quest %person% alicorn 1 elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done mpurge girl endif

triggers.name: dancer_quest_banter
triggers.commands: emote sighs and returns to cleaning the wagon, barely noticed by the prince.

triggers.name: dancer_quest_banter2
triggers.commands: emote sweeps dirt from a corner. wait 4 sigh

triggers.name: Dancer_quest_ASK
triggers.commands: *  This is the initial quest start to the *  relocate quest, other quests can be added *  here with some work but this is going to *  be geared to the classes that get relocate mecho DEBUG: Trigger running for %actor.name% of class (%actor.class%) *  for the time being if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.level% >= 65 if %actor.quest_stage[major_spell_quest]% < 1 if %actor.has_completed[major_spell_quest]% /= false set gogogo 0 if  %actor.class% /= Sorcerer set gogogo 1 end if %actor.class% /= Cryomancer set gogogo 1 end if %actor.class% /= Pyromancer set gogogo 1 end if %gogogo% == 1 wait 1 think wait 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'I've been trapped here for so long.' sigh wait 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'The Prince has me enslaved against my will, will you help set me free?' Say Yer a %actor.class% quest start major_spell_quest %actor.name% else grumble Say Ok, I can talk, I swear %actor.name% is a doofus. end else end else end else end else end

triggers.name: Dancer_quest_ASK2
triggers.commands: * This is to confirm the quest and advance more if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.quest_stage[major_spell_quest]% == 1 wait 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'Oh thank you!' msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'You must gain the princes favor..' msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'then maybe he will give me to you so you can set me free.' mechoabout %actor% %self.name% whispers something to %actor.name% quest advance major_spell_quest %actor.name% * this sets the player to level 2 in the quest wait 5 mforce prince say Hey, what are you talking to them about?! mforce prince sigh wait 2 mforce prince say You can't get good help now days... else end else end

triggers.name: Gypsy_Prince_ask1
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[major_spell_quest]% == 2 wait 1 eye %actor.name% wait 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'Greetings, traveler what brings you to my camp?' mechoabout %actor% %self.name% speaks to %actor.name% in a low voice. else end

triggers.name: Gypsy_prince_ask2
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[major_spell_quest]% == 2 wait 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'Ah, you are looking for my favor?' mechoabout %actor% %self.name% speaks to %actor.name% in a low voice. wait 1 smile me msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'I get that quite a bit, actually... The last adventurer to' msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'seek my favor left our contract imcomplete... If you could' msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'track down that scoundrel and get my prize he is keeping..' msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'I would consider myself in your debt..' wait 1 bow %actor.name% wait 1 ask %actor.name% Will you gon on this quest for me? quest advance major_spell_quest %actor.name% * This sets the player to level 3 in the quest else end

triggers.name: gypsy_prince_ask3
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[major_spell_quest]% == 3 wait 2 mechoabout %actor% %self.name% speaks to %actor.name% in a low voice. msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'Excellent!  That rogue of a guard, a monstrous bronze statue' msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'that now guards the entrance of that accursed village was to' msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'search the Underdark for an item for me.  Go to him and demand' msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'it in the name of the Gypsy Prince of Calia and I shall reward you.' quest advance major_spell_quest %actor.name% * This sets the player to level 4 in the quest else end

triggers.name: Bronze_statue_ask
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[major_spell_quest]% == 4 wait 1 emote snorts flames from his nostrils! growl wait 2 shout What?! That backstabbing rogue wants his prize?! think wait 2 Say Well that's just to bad, I guess I'll just dispatch you myself. quest advance major_spell_quest %actor.name% * This sets the player to level 5 in the quest wait 2 mkill %actor.name% mload obj 52050 else end

rooms.name: A Deep Forest's Edge
rooms.description: Perched on the very cliff of the tallest mountain in the Syric Range, where the forest tapers away, this part of the land has a magnificent view of the lands immediately surrounding it.  Purple mountain peaks stand all around to the north and south, with the Caelian Region spreading far below.  The evergreen forest itself is dense and dark, thinning only right at the edge of the cliff.

West.description: The forest continues, thick and mysterious.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest's Edge
rooms.description: The evergreen forest of ancient trees thins and tapers off here, at a steep cliff.  Beyond the cliff, purple mountains rise up far away.  This mountain is the largest one, but all of them are huge.  Below, far below, the countryside around the ranges is visible.  To the north, the forest opens up enough to allow passage.

North.description: The forest continues.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest's Edge
rooms.description: The evergreen forest to the east tapers off here, on the very edge of a steep cliff that overlooks the rest of the Syric Mountain Range and even the surrounding countryside.  The crisp, clear air is a frigid wind this far up the mountain.  The only way away from the cliff is a break in the forest to the east.

East.description: The forest's edge continues.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest's Edge
rooms.description: The forest tapers off here, at the edge of a very steep cliff overlooking other mountains and, far below, the surrounding countryside. Frigid winds buffet the few saplings that grow here. It is possible to enter the forest to the north and west.

North.description: The forest continues.

West.description: The forest's edge continues.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest's Edge
rooms.description: Perched on the very cliff of the tallest mountain in the Syric Range, this evergreen forest has a magnificent view of the lands immediately surrounding it. Purple mountain peaks poke up out of the mists here and there, far away. A frigid, crisp wind blows strongly here. The forest itself is dense and dark, to the north and east.

North.description: The forest continues.

East.description: The forest continues.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest
rooms.description: The evergreen trees crowd closely together, as if commemorating some remarkable event that happened long ago.  It's quite chilly up here, you notice immediately; this must be because of the higher altitude.  The forest itself is a fairly narrow semicircle that curves around the side of a mountain, a peak you can feel all around you, as if it were a living creature.

East.description: The forest continues to the east.

West.description: The forest continues in its circular flow around the mountain.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest
rooms.description: The evergreen trees crowd closely together, as if commemorating some remarkable event that happened long ago.  It's quite chilly up here, you notice immediately; this must be because of the higher altitude.  The forest itself is a fairly narrow semicircle that curves around the side of a mountain, a peak you can feel all around you, as if it were a living creature.

North.description: You see a footpath to the north.

South.description: The forest continues to the south, circling the mountain.

West.description: The forest continues to the west.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This crudely-made dirt path runs through the middle of a large, old forest. Though the path is mostly clear of debris, here and there grass grows right in its center.  Thick evergreen boughs from the trees overhang the way all along here.  The path runs to the north and east.

North.description: The path continues to the north a short distance.

East.description: The path continues for a ways to the east, up against the side of the mountain.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This path seems fairly recent, since grass still grows here and there in it, though branches and debris are largely absent from it.  Thick evergreen trees blot out most of the light from above, The path runs to the east and west, while you can also enter the forest to the south.

East.description: The trail continues to the east for a ways, up against the side of the mountain.

South.description: The forbiddingly dark and magical forest lies southward.

West.description: The path continues a short distance to the west.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This narrow, packed-earth path runs through a large, ancient forest.  Grass still grows here and there in it, though branches and debris are largely absent from view.  Thick evergreen trees blot out most of the light from above with their overhanging branches.  You notice that you're up against the very face of the mountain, which rises above you.  The path runs to the east and west for a distance.

East.description: The path continues a ways.

West.description: The path continues a ways.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This path seems fairly recent, since grass still grows here and there in it, though at least whoever made the path cleared away most of the branches and debris.  Thick evergreen trees blot out any light from above, making the trail seem dark and mysterious.  You notice that you're up against the very face of the mountain, which rises above you.  The path runs to the east and west.

East.description: The path continues.

West.description: The path continues for quite a distance.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This path seems fairly recent, since grass still grows here and there in it, though at least whoever made the path cleared away most of the branches and debris.  Thick evergreen trees blot out any light from above, making the trail seem dark and mysterious.  You notice that you're up against the very face of the mountain, which rises above you.  The path runs to the west for a distance, while it also branches out to the south.

South.description: The path continues to the south for a ways.

West.description: The path continues on to the west for a ways.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This path seems fairly recent, since grass still grows here and there in it, though at least whoever made the path cleared away most of the branches and debris.  Thick evergreen trees blot out any light from above, making the trail seem dark and mysterious.  You notice that you're up against the very face of the mountain, which rises above you.  The path runs to the east for a distance, while it also branches out to the south.

East.description: The path extends to the east for quite a ways.

South.description: The path continues for a ways to the south.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This path seems fairly recent, since grass still grows here and there in it, though at least whoever made the path cleared away most of the branches and debris.  Thick evergreen trees blot out any light from above, making the trail seem dark and mysterious.  You notice that you're up against the very face of the mountain, which rises above you.  The path runs to the east a ways and to the west.

East.description: The path continues a long way to the east.

South.description: You can leave the path and enter a dark, magical forest to the south.

West.description: The path continues a short way before turning out of sight.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This path seems fairly recent, since grass still grows here and there in it, though at least whoever made the path cleared away most of the branches and debris.  Thick evergreen trees blot out any light from above, making the trail seem dark and mysterious.  You notice that you're up against the very face of the mountain, which rises above you.  The path runs to the east a ways, and to the south and west.

East.description: The path continues a long way to the east.

South.description: You can leave the path and enter a dark, magical forest to the south.

West.description: The path continues a short way before turning out of sight.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This path seems fairly recent, since grass still grows here and there in it, though at least whoever made the path cleared away most of the branches and debris.  Thick evergreen trees blot out any light from above, making the trail seem dark and mysterious.  You notice that you're up against the very face of the mountain, which rises above you.  The path runs to the east and west for a ways.

East.description: The path continues a short way before turning out of sight.

West.description: The path continues a long way to the west.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This path seems fairly recent, since grass still grows here and there in it, though at least whoever made the path cleared away most of the branches and debris.  Thick evergreen trees blot out any light from above, making the trail seem dark and mysterious.  You notice that you're up against the very face of the mountain, which rises above you.  The path runs to the east and west, while you can also enter the forest to the south.

East.description: The path continues a short way before turning out of sight.

South.description: You can leave the path and enter a dark, magical forest to the south.

West.description: The path continues a long way to the west.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This path seems fairly recent, since grass still grows here and there in it, though at least whoever made the path cleared away most of the branches and debris.  Thick evergreen trees blot out any light from above, making the trail seem dark and mysterious.  The path runs to the north and west.

North.description: The path continues, curving around the side of the mountain.

West.description: The path continues against the mountainside.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest
rooms.description: The evergreen trees crowd closely together, as if commemorating some remarkable event that happened long ago.  It's quite chilly up here, you notice immediately; this must be because of the higher altitude.  The forest itself is a fairly narrow semicircle that curves around the side of a mountain, a peak you can feel all around you, as if it were a living creature.

North.description: You see a footpath to the north. Beyond that, the cliff wall of the mountain rises, cold and implacable.

East.description: The forest continues.

South.description: The forest continues to the south.

rooms.name: The Edge of a Dark Forest
rooms.description: This forest is composed mostly of evergreen trees that stand very close together in the semidarkness of tightly-interlaced branches.  It's quite cold, this high up the mountains.  You stand on the edge of a cliff, looking out over majestic vistas.  The forest ends just as suddenly as the cliff begins.  It's quite high up here, high enough that you have an excellent view of the surrounding mountains and other features of the land.

North.description: A game trail is visible from here.

West.description: The forest continues to the west.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This path seems fairly recent, since grass still grows here and there in it, though at least whoever made the path cleared away most of the branches and debris.  Thick evergreen trees blot out any light from above, making the trail seem dark and mysterious.  The path runs to the south and east.

East.description: The path continues to the east a ways. Beyond that, you see the mysterious forest.

South.description: The path continues a short distance before curving out of view.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This path seems fairly recent, since grass still grows here and there in it, though at least whoever made the path cleared away most of the branches and debris.  Thick evergreen trees blot out any light from above, making the trail seem dark and mysterious.  The path runs to the east and west.

East.description: The path continues.

South.description: You can leave the path for the forest.

West.description: The path continues.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This simple little dirt path runs through a large forest.  Ancient evergreen trees overhang the path with their branches, filtering out most of the light and casting shadows onto the path itself.  Grass grows here and there, though there are few stones or other debris.  The path runs to the north and west.

North.description: The path continues, curving out of sight.

East.description: You can leave the path for the forest here.

South.description: You can leave the path for the forest here.

West.description: The path continues.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest's Edge
rooms.description: The forest borders a steep cliff in a thick, bushy tangle of branches and trunks, with the chilly air blowing past them.  Below, down the cliff, other mountains rise up through the clouds, though none is as tall as this mountain. A faint, glowing path leads to the east, though it is difficult to make out clearly.

East.description: A faint, glowing path runs to the east.

West.description: A path runs just west of here.

rooms.name: A Cliffside Altar
rooms.description: This ledge stands at the edge of an ancient evergreen forest.  Tiny footsteps run through the dirt here, leading up to an altar made of obsidian glass.  The jet-dark glass is made into thick sheets that seem to cover something that decomposed inside it long ago into bones, though by now the bones are so badly worn that no one could tell what creature they were in life. Other than that, this is a very simple altar, at the very edge of a monstrously steep cliff.

North.description: The forest's edge continues.

West.description: A glowing path runs to the west.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath Up Against a Steep Mountain
rooms.description: This little dirt path runs through a thick, evergreen forest, skirting the edge of the mountain.  Grass grows here and there in it, though it is largely free of other debris.  Thick evergreen branches overhang the trail and also filter out most of the light from above.  The path runs to the south and east.

East.description: The path continues before curving out of sight to the east.

South.description: The path continues before curving out of sight to the south.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: A simple little path runs through a thick forest, skirting the edge of the mountain.  Though grass grows in it here and there, it is mostly free of debris.  Thick evergreen branches blot out most of the light from above.  The path runs to the north and west.

North.description: The path ends to the north.

West.description: The path bends to the west, following the curve of the mountain.

rooms.name: The King's Sacrifice
rooms.description: A glowing path leads to a stone tablet standing in the middle of a thick, forest glade.  Magical-seeming fireflies dance around the tablet, illumining it very gently.  The trees form a little grove around the tablet, which is made of white marble, mounted on a base of dark marble.  The flat circle, about as wide across as a human is tall, is engraved deeply, obviously as a marker of some sort, though to what, you cannot tell from here.

North.description: The forest continues to the north.

South.description: A glowing path leads to the south.

extras.text: One figure is of someone who is clearly a king, dressed in royal robes and wearing a crown. Beside him stands a woman who is just as clearly his queen -- and your breath catches in your throat at her raw majesty and power. This is no fainting flower of a woman, but, rather, a warrioress with clear and obvious strengths. She must be one of the most powerful fighters of her age. Standing in front of the first two is a youth, his face full of hope and joy -- and power of his own. Though the tablet is old, their expressions are not weathered away; you can see that they are a proud and regal family.
The stone tablet is circular in shape. Its diameter is easily the length of a man's body. Made of elegant marble, it is carved with three proud humanoid figures.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath Up Against a Mountain
rooms.description: This narrow, primitive path skirts the very edge of a tall mountain that rises to the north.  The path seems to end here in a last spurt of trail-ishness, and beyond it, the forest itself takes over.  There is no obvious reason for it to end, except for the density of the ancient evergreen trees themselves.

North.description: The forest continues to the north.

South.description: The path continues to the south.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest
rooms.description: This dark forest of evergreens is dense and difficult to walk through.  The air is cold, and the light fitful, coming down through the thick branches of the trees as it does.  To the south, you see the trees give way for a grove of some kind, while, to the north and east, the forest continues.

North.description: The forest continues for a ways.

East.description: The forest ends at a ledge to the east.

South.description: A circular stone tablet stands to the south.

rooms.name: The Edge of a Deep Forest
rooms.description: This part of the forest skirts the edge of a huge cliff that falls away to the south through valleys.  The crisp, cold wind brings no noises of animals or birds, though it does whistle slightly as it passes by the large evergreen trees.  Passage is difficult; the only visible way through here is to the west.

West.description: The forest continues.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest
rooms.description: Tall, stark evergreens make up this thick forest, their branches twining together to cast shadows down to the ground. The sky is impossible to see from below those trees. There is no path per se through them, but there are narrow openings one may squeeze through to the east and south.

East.description: The forest continues.

South.description: The forest continues.

rooms.name: The Edge of a Deep Forest
rooms.description: Thick trees clustered close together end abruptly at the edge of a steep cliff that careers straight down into mist.  You can't tell what's at the bottom!  The ledge is circular in shape, you determine, girdling a tall mountain that rises far to the west.

North.description: The forest's edge continues.

West.description: The forest continues. Not far away, you see a steep cliff.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest Up Against a Mountain
rooms.description: This enchanted forest -- for it is clearly under some kind of ancient spell -- circles the highest mountain in the entire Syric Mountain Range like a ribbon.  Here it comes up against the edge of the mountain itself.  You can run your hands along the mountain's steep surface and admire how it rises so far above your head that it skims the clouds.  The forest is tapering off here.

East.description: The forest continues.

South.description: The forest continues.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest Up Against a Mountain
rooms.description: This enchanted forest -- for it is clearly under some kind of ancient spell -- circles the highest mountain in the entire Syric Mountain Range like a ribbon.  Here it comes up against the edge of the mountain itself.  You can run your hands along the mountain's steep surface and admire how it rises so far above your head that it skims the clouds.  The mountain slopes very steeply up to the north, making it impossible for the trees to grow.

East.description: The forest continues.

West.description: The forest continues.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest's Edge
rooms.description: Evergreen trees make up this part of the dense forest.  Their boughs filter out most of the light from above.  A frigid wind whistles through them.  The ground slopes upward gently, swelling toward the north.

North.description: The forest ends to the north.

South.description: The forest's edge continues.

West.description: The forest continues.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest Up Against a Mountain
rooms.description: This large, ancient evergreen forest circles the highest mountain in the entire Syric Mountain Range like a ribbon.  Here it comes up against the edge of the mountain itself.  The bare mountain itself rises up into the clouds. The forest ends here, where the mountain's slope is so steep, to the north, that it cannot support tree life.

South.description: The forest continues.

rooms.name: The Edge of a Deep Forest
rooms.description: This magical forest of evergreens ends at a sheer cliff face that slopes off to the south.  There's no way to climb down it, and even if you could, you can't lay odds that you'd survive the rocky chasm that you think is the floor of the valley.  The mountain itself rises to the north; the trees cover its slope for the most part.

North.description: The forest continues to the north.

South.description: The forest edge continues to the south.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This little trail runs to the north and east through a large, dense evergreen forest.  Grass grows here and there in it, though it is free of other debris.  Some of the trees near the path are nicked by what looks for all the world like blade-cuts.

North.description: The footpath continues for a ways.

East.description: The footpath continues.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest Up Against a Mountain
rooms.description: This large, evergreen forest circles a narrow flat stretch of land that girdles the mountain before it slopes upward again.  The light filters down through the branches of the trees, casting shadows on the ground.  The way is clear to the north and west.

North.description: The forest ends to the north.

West.description: The forest continues.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This path leads through an enchanted forest.  At first you think that it must be fairly recent, since it appears so rarely-traveled, but that can't be so -- the trees are so carefully arranged around the path.  Just beyond the confines of the narrow dirt path, rusted helmets, chain vests, and swords can be seen rotting on the ground.

North.description: You see a burned wooden object to the north, in the forest.

East.description: The footpath continues.

South.description: You can leave the footpath and enter the mysterious forest.

West.description: The footpath continues.

extras.text: They're not in any particular order -- in fact, they appear to have been tossed onto the ground randomly. Moss and plants grow up around and through most of them.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This footpath hugs the edge of a steeply sloping mountain that rises to the north, far above your head.  The forest crowds around the path, seeming almost enchanted.

South.description: The path continues to the south, curving out of sight.

West.description: The path continues on to the west for a short distance.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest
rooms.description: This large, dark evergreen forest is so dense that the only way through it from here is to the north.  The cold mountain wind whistles through the topmost branches of the evergreens.  The trees have sharp nicks and cuts in their bark, visible even from far away.

North.description: The forest continues to the north.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest
rooms.description: The evergreen trees crowd closely together in this ancient forest. Mountain wind blows crisp and clean through the old trees.  The forest itself is a fairly narrow semicircle that curves around the side of a huge mountain. Aside from the wind itself, this place is utterly quiet.

East.description: You see a footpath to the east.

South.description: The forest continues to the south.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath
rooms.description: This narrow little footpath is mostly bare of debris and branches, but grass still grows here and there along its length.  The pine trees that surround it on both sides are lightly dusted with frost, and sometimes some white flakes blow onto the trail the branches overhang.

North.description: The footpath continues to the north.

East.description: You see a burned, broken down object to the east.

South.description: The footpath continues to the south.

West.description: You can leave the path and explore the forest to the west.

rooms.name: The Site of an Ancient Battle
rooms.description: You enter a little grove.  The trees stand in a semicircle around a burned and broken wooden wagon.  The wagon is of the type gypsies and merchants use to transport people and goods.  But now it's so blackened by fire that the only way you can tell it's a wagon's husk is the presence of some rusted-out iron-reinforced wheels around it.  A few broken swords lie around, more testimony to the ancient battle.

South.description: You see a footpath running just south of here.

West.description: You see a footpath running just west of here.

rooms.name: The Edge of a Deep Forest
rooms.description: This part of the forest borders the very edge of a steep downward cliff. The mountain the trees encircle rises far above the forest to the north.  You have a magnificent view of the panoramaic vista below and before you.

North.description: The forest continues to the north.

East.description: The forest continues to the east.

South.description: The forest's border continues to the south.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest
rooms.description: The evergreen trees crowd closely together, as if commemorating some remarkable event that happened long ago.  It's quite chilly up here, you notice immediately; this must be because of the higher altitude.  The forest itself is a fairly narrow semicircle that curves around the side of a mountain, a peak you can feel all around you, as if it were a living creature.

North.description: The forest continue sto the north.

West.description: The forest continues to the west.

rooms.name: A Crude Footpath's End
rooms.description: This narrow little footpath is mostly bare of debris and branches, but you suspect it's been a long time since anyone walked on it.  It ends here, in a cluster of pine needles and loose, moist earth.  The forest extends in all directions -- but there is nothing in sight that this path could have been leading toward.

North.description: You can enter a stand of trees to the north.

South.description: The footpath continues.

rooms.name: The Edge of a Deep Forest
rooms.description: Dense, evergreen trees form the cliffside ledge of a narrow band of level ground around a huge mountain that rises to the north.  It's quite cold, with a frigid wind blowing through the branches of the ancient trees.  Other than the sound of the wind, it is utterly quiet.

South.description: The forest's edge continues.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest
rooms.description: The evergreen trees crowd closely together, so close that traveling is almost difficult.  Though most light is blocked out, somehow a chill wind manages to whistle through the trees.  The forest itself is a fairly narrow semicircle that curves around the side of a mountain, but nobody could see the mountain's peak through all of the branches crowding out the sky.

North.description: The forest continues to the north, circling around the mountain.

East.description: The forest continues to the east.

South.description: The forest continues to the south.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest Up Against a Mountain
rooms.description: The evergreen forest juts up against the side of a steep mountain that rises far above your head, into the clouds.  The forest itself encircles the mountain like a ribbon.  The trees are huge, probably hundreds of years old.

North.description: The forest continues.

South.description: You see a footpath to the south.

West.description: The forest continues.

rooms.name: The Edge of a Deep Forest
rooms.description: These dense, evergreen trees form the cliffside ledge of a narrow band of level ground around a huge mountain that rises to the north.  It's quite cold up here, with a frigid mountain wind whistling through the branches of the large trees.  Other than the noise of the wind, however, the forest is utterly quiet.

South.description: The forest continues.

rooms.name: A Deep Forest Up Against a Mountain
rooms.description: The evergreen forest juts up against the side of a steep mountain that rises far above your head, into the clouds.  The forest itself encircles the mountain like a ribbon.  The trees are huge, probably hundreds of years old.

North.description: The forest continues to the north.

South.description: The forest continues to the south.
